title: the worst item in the game
body:
{{item:3052}} 

still hasnt been adressed after a whole year. makes you pay 450 gold for stats that you dont actually get until you have farmed 6 minion waves (30 minions).

what is the point of the farm requirement on the item, when it doesnt end up significantly more cost efficient than its stats worth in gold, like {{item:3070}} or {{item:3027}}, but merely ends up giving you the stats you should have been getting from the start?

why cant it just give an extra {{item:1028}} worth in health, upon paying for it?

> 
> imo that's pretty equal, especially knowing that you'll get more stats over time (up to another 150hp) *and* that the item builds into other items as well

it doesnt give 150 hp and 15 ad on purchase.

it gives 5 ad on purchase for 450 gold. but all combined items are slightly more stat efficient that its components. except for jaurims, which makes you pay gold and then farm minions, just to get your gold back.

the 150 hp and 15 ad just carry over from its components, that you already payed for?
in what parallel universe are jaurims fist and doran's blade the same price?

> [{quoted}](name=Slythion,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=QcYzpYNX,comment-id=00010000000100000000,timestamp=2016-11-30T19:03:03.395+0000)

> We're comparing it to other items, not it's "step up" from it's components.
> 
> Compared to DBlade, the stats from Fist are actually pretty decent considering how they are the same price. Especially given it's scaling value and how it builds into other items, unlike DBlade.
> 
> Sure, it may not be an amazing improvement on immediate value if you've already gotten it's compenent items, but you also aren't paying a lot *and* you have scaling values. It's hardly a gold sinkhole

we are comparing it to items like {{item:3086}} 

do you have to buy the components for a zeal, and then pay 600 gold in combine cost to get 3% attack speed and have to farm up the 10% crit chance to make it actually return its cost in stats?

no, you get straight up 3% attack speed, 10% crit chance and 5% movement speed for 600 gold over its components.

youre right. {{item:3052}} is not a "step up" from its components. its literally a step down.

the item actually is a sinkhole for your gold, that doesnt even pay off by turing positive in gold effectiveness like other farm items do. it merely returns its own value after 30 minions, but until then its worth less than you payed for.
{{item:3191}} isn't on the same boat? it basically is to prevent it to become another Brutalizer, whee you get it early and then sell it since the item was only efficient on his advance item state.

so while it starts gold inefficient, the fully farmed item becomes very gold efficient.

meanwhile jaurims fist puts you about 400 gold behind, and the fully farmed item just puts you back to 0.
Who needs Ohmwrecker when towers already deal 0 damage?
maybe because the item's scaling is irelavent since it maxes itself out upon combining it?

while youre puring 450 gold into absolutely nothing, your opponent can get {{item:1028}} for the same price and get an immediate advantage over you.

https://pbs.twimg.com/media/Bp0Gu8aCUAAB2aA.jpg

Hmm... well Fist builds into Hydra (450 health), Mallet (700 health) and Steraks (400 health).

A fully stacked Fist is worth 300 Health. Sterak's has no additional health component, so you get 100 Health for completing it. Mallet has a 380 Health Belt, so it only picks up a meager 20 Health. Titanic has 150 Health from Ruby, so it gains nothing at all.

I think the easiest solution would be to drop the cost of Fist to 900 Gold. In essence, make it very similar to Seeker's, which only requires 165 gold to complete that wonky item.

Edit: I forgot about the 5 AD bonus.  1000 Gold sound better?

how about just entirely removing the farm requirement?

yea, the item wouldnt have some special passive. it would just grant a boring combination of its base stats worth in gold. but its supposed to be just a component item anyways.

why not make it 1200 gold for 300 health and 15 ad directly upon purchase?

But that doesn't make the item better. Reducing the cost makes it gold efficient and valuable. An extra 200 gold could be used to pink ward or be enough extra gold to pick up boots or cloth armor. 

Removing the stacking mechanism makes it gold neutral. It's not a bad suggestion, considering the present state of Fist is gold negative till you can get 30 minions.

Agreed, it should be about even when you buy it but very gold efficient once farmed.  I also think the value of the item should scale with how many stacks you have.  If you buy it and don't farm it, it should cost more to upgrade than if you did farm it, kind of like the new poacher's dirk.

I think they should keep the stats the same, cut the combine cost to 150, and have the passive stacks increase its value by about 15g to make it worthwile to buy early and cut down on combine costs.
